results.title: Pat Robertson, Who Gave Christian Conservatives Clout, Is Dead at 93
results.abstract: A Baptist minister and a broadcaster, he turned evangelicals into a powerful constituency that helped Republicans capture Congress in 1994. He had earlier run for president.

results.title: George Winston, Pianist With a Popular Soothing Sound, Dies at 74
results.abstract: He won a Grammy in the new age category, and his top-selling records helped define the genre. But his interests also included Hawaiian guitar and the Doors.

media.caption: The pianist George Winston in an undated publicity photo. His music, he said, was “melodic and not complicated in its approach, like folk guitar picking and folk songs.”

results.abstract: With “infinity dollars” poured in by the creators of “South Park,” a fabled Colorado restaurant reopens with the same 1970s vibe and drastically improved food.

media.caption: The refurbished Casa Bonita, a beloved, and mocked, Colorado institution. The 56,000-square-foot Mexican restaurant went bankrupt during the pandemic but was rescued by new owners, Trey Parker and Matt Stone of “South Park” fame.

results.title: New York City Residents Will Soon Have to Compost Their Food Scraps
results.abstract: The City Council passed a bill on Thursday requiring New Yorkers to separate their food waste from regular trash, with mandatory composting coming to all five boroughs by next year.

results.title: Wildfires Spread Smoke, and Anxiety, Across Canada to the U.S.

results.title: Record Pollution and Heat Herald a Season of Climate Extremes

results.title: Astrud Gilberto, 83, Dies; Shot to Fame With ‘The Girl From Ipanema’
results.abstract: It was the first song she ever recorded. And it played a key role in making the Brazilian sound known as bossa nova a phenomenon in the United States.

media.caption: The singer Astrud Gilberto in 1972. She had a four-decade recording career, but her biggest success came at the very beginning, with “The Girl From Ipanema.”
